```{r, eval = FALSE }
library(webchem) 
library(rcdk)
library(kableExtra)
```

Can't use  `cir_query` because some CASRNs aren't in the *Chemical Identifier Resolver*. 

```{r}
library(webchem) 
library(rcdk)

CASRN <- c("73829-36-4",
           "196859-54-8",
           "171978-95-3",
           "862374-87-6",
           "1763-23-1",
           "754-91-6")


cids <- get_cid(CASRN) # get's the pubchem Compound IDs (cids)

# Get properties listed on pubchem
x <- pc_prop(cids$cid,
             properties = c("MolecularFormula", 
                            "CanonicalSMILES",
                            "MonoisotopicMass",
                            "XLogP"))
# Saving search query results for future analysis 
write.csv(x, file = "moleculesAndProperties.csv", row.names = FALSE)

y <- subset.data.frame(x, select = c("CanonicalSMILES", "CAS"))

write.table(y, file = "smilesForChemmineR.smi", 
            row.names = FALSE, 
            col.names = FALSE, 
            quote = FALSE,
            sep = '\t')

 smiset <- read.SMIset("smilesForChemmineR.smi")
 
 sdfset <- smiles2sdf(smiset)

```

```{r}



```


**SDF* stands for *structural-date file*, a chemical file format that describes molecuales and chemcails reactions. [Read up more here](http://www.structuralchemistry.org/pcsb/capp_cdf.php).
